title: Coming Soon: IINTS-AF Launch
summary: On March 27, 2026, we will shift from mechanical innovation to intelligent autonomy. IINTS-AF launches as an open-source gateway for independent adaptive insulin research.

title: Breaking the Black Box
summary: Why I decided to reverse engineer commercial insulin pumps. When my life depends on a machine, I need to know how it thinks.
content:
Why I did it.
Commercial pumps are amazing, but they are black boxes. We input carbs, they output insulin. But what happens in between?

This post explores the journey of opening up my first pump and realizing that the 'magic' inside was actually understandable engineering.

title: Hardware vs. Software
summary: The lessons I learned transitioning from the mechanical precision of the Raspberry Pi Pico to the AI capabilities of the Jetson Nano.
content:
Building the body (V1) was about reliability. Building the brain (AF) is about probability.

In this log, I discuss how I integrated the two systems using MQTT bridge technology.

title: The Ethics of AI in Healthcare
summary: Why a 'Safety Supervisor' is essential in autonomous care. We can't let AI run wild on human biology.
content:
AI is powerful, but it hallucinates. When it's writing a poem, that's funny. When it's dosing insulin, that's fatal.

That's why IINTS-AF introduces the concept of a deterministic Safety Supervisor.
